body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of South Dakota:
examples: The few genetically pure bison herds in the United States include those in the Yellowstone and Wind Cave national parks.
"This is real hard-core caving," said Jim, a 48-year veteran spelunker who works at Wind Cave National Park.
